{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:43.440
    | text      = But as he does so frequently, what he's doing is presenting a warp version of reality and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:47.600
    | text      = completely erasing all context from the conversation.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:50.159
    | text      = In this case, what Alex is talking about is the stop and frisk policy that the NYPD operated
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:54.879
    | text      = under to a particularly troubling extent from the early two thousands to about 2013.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:00.159
    | text      = The policy was an outgrowth of the broken windows policing ideology that held the areas
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:04.480
    | text      = where petty crimes were higher served as Petri dishes in which larger, more serious crimes
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:09.120
    | text      = would naturally spring forth.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:10.879
    | text      = Following that logic, the police prioritize stopping petty crimes like public urination,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:15.039
    | text      = public transit fare evasion, and the like thinking that doing so would create an environment
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:19.120
    | text      = where more serious crime wouldn't take hold.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:21.279
    | text      = How did that go?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:22.240
    | text      = Didn't go great.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:22.960
    | text      = Oh, that's the public facing part of the argument.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:25.919
    | text      = In reality, it was just a way to shake down and terrorize minorities.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:29.759
    | text      = In 2010, a police officer named Adrian Schoolcraft leaked secretly recorded tapes of police roll
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:34.720
    | text      = call meetings in the 81st district of the Bedford Stuyvesant area that clearly show
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:40.480
    | text      = the commanding officers explicitly telling their officers that they were going to be
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:44.320
    | text      = in trouble if they didn't reach their quotas of tickets and reports filed.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:48.320
    | text      = Schoolcraft was detained and forcefully held at a mental hospital for six days in retaliation
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:52.879
    | text      = for leaking the tapes, ultimately being forced to pay $7,000 for his own imprisonment.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:57.919
    | text      = At the practice's peak in 2011, 685,724 people were stopped and frisked in New York.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:05.279
    | text      = Of these people, 88% were completely innocent of any crime, a number that is super consistent
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:10.399
    | text      = with yearly data analyzed by the New York Civil Liberties Union.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:13.919
    | text      = In the years between 2002 and 2013, when the program was in full effect, the ratio of innocent
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:19.360
    | text      = people being stopped was never lower than 80%.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:22.559
    | text      = Interestingly, in all those years you want to look at them, at any of them, the percentage
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:26.559
    | text      = of people being stopped and frisked who happened to be white was never higher than 12%.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:30.960
    | text      = Odd.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:31.679
    | text      = Which is strange considering that New York City is approximately 44% white demographically.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:36.320
    | text      = Seems strange.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:37.120
    | text      = Very.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:37.600
    | text      = Seems out of control, really.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker
